MA-plot: plot differences versus averages for high-throughput data

Source: R/plotMA-methods.R
plotMA.Rd

A generic function which produces an MA-plot for an object containing microarray, RNA-Seq or other data.

plotMA(object, ...)

# S4 method for DESeqResults
plotMA(object, genes = NULL,
  gene2symbol = NULL, ntop = 0L, direction = c("both", "up", "down"),
  pointColor = getOption("basejump.point.color", "gray50"),
  sigPointColor = getOption("basejump.sig.point.color", c(upregulated =
  "purple", downregulated = "orange")), return = c("ggplot",
  "DataFrame"))

# S4 method for DESeqAnalysis
plotMA(object, results = 1L,
  lfcShrink = TRUE, genes = NULL, ntop = 0L, direction = c("both",
  "up", "down"), pointColor = getOption("basejump.point.color",
  "gray50"), sigPointColor = getOption("basejump.sig.point.color",
  c(upregulated = "purple", downregulated = "orange")),
  return = c("ggplot", "DataFrame"))

plotMeanAverage(...)

Arguments

object

A data object, typically containing count values from an RNA-Seq experiment or microarray intensity values.
...

Additional arguments, for use in specific methods.
genes

character. Genes to include. These must match the rownames of the object. It is best practice to use the stable gene identifiers from Ensembl (e.g. "ENSG00000000003") and not the gene symbols.
gene2symbol

gene2symbol. Gene-to-symbol mappings. Must contain geneID and geneName columns, with rownames defined.
ntop

scalar integer. Number of top genes to label.
direction

string. Plot "both", "up", or "down" directions.
pointColor

string. Default point color for the plot.
sigPointColor

character. Color names for labeling upregulated and downregulated genes. Also supports a character string for labeling DEGs with the same color, regardless of direction.
return

string. Object class to return. Uses match.arg() internally and picks the first item in the vector by default.
results

scalar. Position or name of DESeqResults.
lfcShrink

boolean. Use shrunken log2 fold change (LFC) values.

Value

ggplot.

Details

An MA plot is an application of a Bland–Altman plot for visual representation of genomic data. The plot visualizes the differences between measurements taken in two samples, by transforming the data onto M (log ratio) and A (mean average) scales, then plotting these values.

See also

DESeq2::plotMA().

Examples

object <- bcbioRNASeq::deseq_small
print(object)
#> DESeqAnalysis 1.21.22
#> http://bioinformatics.sph.harvard.edu/bcbioRNASeq
#> citation("bcbioRNASeq")
#> transform: vst
#> contrastNames: treatment folic acid vs control
#> class: DESeqDataSet 
#> dim: 500 6 
#> metadata(11): version caller ... date sessionInfo
#> assays(4): counts mu H cooks
#> rownames(500): ENSMUSG00000000088 ENSMUSG00000000326 ...
#>   ENSMUSG00000114367 ENSMUSG00000114458
#> rowData names(29): broadClass description ... deviance maxCooks
#> colnames(6): control_rep1 control_rep2 ... fa_day7_rep2 fa_day7_rep3
#> colData names(8): sampleName day ... interestingGroups sizeFactor

## DESeqAnalysis ====
## This is the current recommended method.

dds <- as(object, "DESeqDataSet")
g2s <- Gene2Symbol(dds)
geneIDs <- head(g2s[["geneID"]])
print(geneIDs)
#> [1] "ENSMUSG00000000088" "ENSMUSG00000000326" "ENSMUSG00000000346"
#> [4] "ENSMUSG00000000740" "ENSMUSG00000001175" "ENSMUSG00000001666"
geneNames <- head(g2s[["geneName"]])
print(geneNames)
#> [1] "Cox5a"  "Comt"   "Dazap2" "Rpl13"  "Calm1"  "Ddt"   

plotMA(object)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)

## Customize the colors.
plotMA(
    object = object,
    pointColor = "black",
    sigPointColor = "purple"
)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)
plotMA(
    object = object,
    sigPointColor = c(
        upregulated = "green",
        downregulated = "red"
    )
)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)

## Directional support (up or down).
plotMA(object, direction = "up", ntop = 5L)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)
plotMA(object, direction = "down", ntop = 5L)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)

## Label genes manually.
## Note that either gene IDs or names (symbols) are supported.
plotMA(object = object, genes = geneIDs)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)
plotMA(object = object, genes = geneNames)
#> DESeqResults: treatment folic acid vs control (shrunken LFC)
